Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.basic

Class PureLibSettings

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.basic.PureLibSettings
public final class PureLibSettings
extends java.lang.Object

This class keeps basic settings for the Pure Library. You can use default settings for the Pure Library environment (file purelib.default.properties inside the purelib jar) or can import explicit settings by the -D"purelib.settings.source" variable when starting java application. This class must be used by it's singleton instance by calling instance() static method. Content got from -D"purelib.settings.source" source will be joined with the default settings from purelib.default.properties and has higher priority related to purelib.default.properties. This class also contains few static useful methods to process settings

Inner logger in the class is used to print out any internal problems in the Pure Library. It uses standard Logger functionality. Logger name is "chav1961.purelib". You can control it by the standard Java logging mechanism

Inner Timer in the class is used to process different sorts of maintenance, required by Pure Library components. Timer works with a daemon thread and needs no action on application terminating

Since:
0.0.2
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
SubstitutableProperties, JUnit tests
LastUpdate:
0.0.4

  • Method Details

    • instance

      public static SubstitutableProperties instance()

      Static singleton instance to get access to the Pure Library settings. Instance is a SubstitutableProperties object and supports all it's functionality

      singleton instance of the Pure Library settings

      public static ColorScheme defaultColorScheme()

    • colorByName

      public static java.awt.Color colorByName​(java.lang.String name, java.awt.Color defaultColor) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      Convert color name to it's Color representation

      Parameters:
      name - name to convert
      defaultColor - default Color instance if name can't be converted
      Returns:
      Color converted. Can't be null
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if color name is null or empty

    • nameByColor

      public static java.lang.String nameByColor​(java.awt.Color color, java.lang.String defaultName) throws java.lang.NullPointerException

      Convert Color instance to it's symbolic name

      Parameters:
      color - color to convert
      defaultName - default name if color can't be converted
      Returns:
      Color name or default name
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if color instance to convert is null

    • installHelpContent

      public static void installHelpContent​(java.lang.String helpPath, FileSystemInterface helpContent) throws SyntaxException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, ContentException, java.io.IOException

      Install help content to the application

      Parameters:
      helpPath - help path in the http://localhost:/
      helpContent - static help content
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - help when content is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when help path is null or empty
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if help system is not available
      SyntaxException - syntax errors in the help content
      ContentException - errors in the help content
      java.io.IOException - I/O errors on installation
      Since:
      0.0.3

    • uninstallHelpContent

      public static void uninstallHelpContent​(java.lang.String helpPath) throws SyntaxException, java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, ContentException, java.io.IOException

      Parameters:
      helpPath - help path in the http://localhost:/
